user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_dauth_qop:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthQOP
get_rq_dauth_qop (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const qop_param)
{
  if (NULL == qop_param->value.str)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_NONE;
  if (qop_param->quoted)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  else
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  /* No know QOP has been detected */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_INVALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No definite violation in this fragment as written: the code checks for NULL and passes an explicit length (qop_param->value.len) to a bounded comparator (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n). However a violation can occur if the length does not correctly describe the accessible size of qop_param->value.str or if the helper function itself uses unbounded <string.h> calls. Example violating scenario: qop_param->value.str points to a 4‑byte buffer but qop_param->value.len is 10 (or is larger than the allocated buffer) or the helper internally calls strlen/strcmp/strcpy on the pointer — that would allow out‑of‑bounds accesses and thus violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
